page.title: 16Power: Oil/Nuclear
page.content: {Oil} is a fossil fuel which is found deep underground, even beneath the sea bed. The oil is pumped from the well to refineries where it is seperated into different grades. It can be used for {heating, cooking, cars and industry.} {Nuclear power} produces heat by splitting atoms, as in nuclear bombs. This heat is used as a source of energy to produce electricity. Experiments are currently going ahead to generate heat by fusing atoms together. This will have the advantage of not leaving a radio-active waste product. There is much concern that oil will not last much longer, that nuclear energy may be harmful and that coal is difficult and dangerous to extract. {Alternative sources of energy} are being sought. Wind power and water power are popular ideas, but they are not yet good enough for commercial use.
